author: jason.carver
content: Shower thought: in order to modify the commitment mechanism (say, from MPT to verkle) we need access to the full underlying state, of course. That's fine because we haven't expired any state yet.

author: jason.carver
content: After we expire state, though, it becomes much more difficult. We would have to collect all the expired state (which may be hard, even outside of the protocol).

author: jason.carver
content: In fact, it may not be possible, because the underlying state could theoretically get permanently lost.

author: .vbuterin
content: I think the idea is that we would just let the older epochs work according to the old commitment mechanism

author: .vbuterin
content: If we can find all the older state, then we can do a hard fork to switch it over

author: .vbuterin
content: But if we can't, that's not a problem
